files.description: Project configuration defining package metadata, dependencies, and the psyprim console-script entry point.
Documentation describing the mission-aligned workflow plan, community engagement steps, metadata checklists, evaluation methods, and CLI usage examples.
Package initializer exporting the library version and top-level public interfaces.
Complete Typer-based CLI implementing workflow commands for initializing projects, generating checklists, validating metadata, and producing citation/provenance reports.
Pydantic models for standardized primary-source records including edition/translation provenance, variant pagination, and public-domain citation fields.
Implements metadata checklist templates, required/optional fields, and risk-weighted validation rules for scholarship workflows.
Utilities to represent and validate edition/translation provenance chains, source repositories, and transformation steps.
Logic for handling and validating variant pagination mappings (print page to digital locator) and emitting canonical citation locators.
Generates standardized public-domain-friendly citations (including archive identifiers and access dates) and machine-readable citation exports.
Implements survey and audit-study scaffolding (instrument templates, sampling plans, audit rubrics) and produces analysis-ready JSON/CSV outputs.
End-to-end tests exercising key CLI workflows: init, checklist generation, metadata validation, and report/citation outputs.
Unit tests covering models and validators for provenance, pagination variants, and public-domain citation requirements.

missionDescription: Design a rigorous, implementable plan for developing and validating standardized workflows, metadata checklists, and lightweight tooling for primary-source scholarship in psychology. The plan should specify steps for community engagement, technical feature set (edition/translation provenance, variant pagination, public-domain citations), empirical evaluation methods (surveys and audit studies), and integration/test milestones.
missionSuccessCriteria: Deliver a step-by-step development and validation roadmap (milestones, deliverables, and responsible roles) that can be handed to engineering, archival partners, and journal collaborators.

Specify a prioritized feature list for the lightweight tools/plugins (minimum viable features vs. stretch features) with clear definitions of how edition/translation provenance and variant page/paragraph numbering will be detected or flagged.

Provide a concrete empirical evaluation design: sample sizes, sampling frames (journals, archives, repositories), survey instruments outline, audit study protocols, and pre-registered outcome measures to test effects on citation accuracy, reproducibility, and researcher workload.

Include a timeline with resource estimates and criteria for pilot success (benchmarks for adoption, reduction in citation errors, reproducibility improvements) enabling a go/no-go decision for broader rollout.
